u_shaped_ranking.context_window: sediment is an essential, integral and dynamic part of the ecosystem. Much material dredged from navigation channels within the OSPAR Maritime Area is considered to be either uncontaminated or only mildly contaminated by human activities (i.e. close to natural background levels). However, in some areas dredged material is contaminated to an extent that environmental constraints need to be applied when considering management options.

Our vision is a clean, healthy and biologically diverse North-East Atlantic Ocean, which is productive, used sustainably and resilient to climate change and ocean acidification.

Together with European Union and national regulations, OSPAR measures have led to a reduction in
